fields.title: Sum of N Numbers
fields.description:
Given an integer N, calculate the sum of first N natural numbers.

Input

One integer N on the first line.

Output

One integer, the sum of the first N natural numbers.

Constraints

  • 1 ≤ N ≤ 106

Example

Input
5
Output
15

fields.title: Find the Missing Number
fields.description:
Given an array of size N-1 containing numbers from 1 to N, find the missing number.

Input

One integer N on the first line.
N-1 integers on the second line.

Output

One integer, the missing number.

Constraints

  • 1 ≤ N ≤ 105

Example

Input
5
1 2 4 5
Output
3

fields.title: Longest Increasing Subsequence
fields.description:
Given an array of integers, find the length of the longest increasing subsequence.

Input

One integer N on the first line.
N integers on the second line.

Output

One integer, the length of the longest increasing subsequence.

Constraints

  • 1 ≤ N ≤ 103

Example

Input
6
5 8 3 7 9 1
Output
3

fields.title: Knapsack Problem
fields.description:
Given weights and values of N items, put these items in a knapsack of capacity W to get the maximum total value in the knapsack.

Input

Two integers N and W on the first line.
N integers representing weights on the second line.
N integers representing values on the third line.

Output

One integer, the maximum total value in the knapsack.

Constraints

  • 1 ≤ N ≤ 102
  • 1 ≤ W ≤ 104

Example

Input
3 50
10 20 30
60 100 120
Output
220

fields.title: Graph Coloring Problem
fields.description:
Given an undirected graph and a number m, determine if the graph can be colored with at most m colors such that no two adjacent vertices of the graph are colored with the same color.

Input

One integer N on the first line.
One integer m on the second line.
List of edges of the graph.

Output

True if the graph can be colored with at most m colors, otherwise False.

Constraints

  • 1 ≤ N ≤ 102
  • 1 ≤ m ≤ 10

Example

Input
4
3
1 2
2 3
3 4
4 1
Output
True

fields.title: Reverse a Linked List
fields.description:
Given the head of a singly linked list, reverse the list, and return the reversed list.

Input

First line contains the number of nodes N.
Second line contains N space-separated integers representing the nodes of the linked list.

Output

Return the reversed linked list as space-separated integers.

Constraints

  • 1 ≤ N ≤ 1000

Example

Input
5
1 2 3 4 5
Output
5 4 3 2 1

fields.title: TLE Problem Example
fields.description:
Given an integer N, print all numbers from 1 to N in separate lines.

Input

One integer N on the first line.

Output

All numbers from 1 to N in separate lines.

Constraints

  • 1 ≤ N ≤ 108

Example

Input
5
Output
1
2
3
4
5
